description: Even if a trade deal materializes, the industry is betting the world won’t want to go back to one supplier.
title: Rare Earths Producers Look to US-Led Boom to Blunt China’s Power

author: Mia Glass
description: Traders in the Japanese government bond market are on high alert Tuesday for any sign that President Donald Trump will increase pressure on his ally to make a bigger boost to military spending.
title: Trump’s Japan Trip Fuels Bond Market Worries on Defense Spending

author: Youkyung Lee, Susie Kang, Ruth Carson
description: Kim Ji-yeon is so worried about South Korea’s currency that she’s moving all the money she can into US stocks and gold. A key reason: Korea’s pledge to invest $350 billion in the US, a figure that has stoked fears of spiraling losses in the currency.
title: Trump Sparks Korean Capital Flight With $350 Billion Demand

author: Amara Omeokwe
description: Five contenders are still standing in the high-stakes race to be the next Federal Reserve chair.
title: Here Are the Five Contenders to Replace Powell as Fed Chair

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: A judge in Utah said the 22-year-old man accused of killing conservative commentator Charlie Kirk can wear civilian clothes in court rather than his jail fatigues, but he’ll have to appear with some form of physical restraints.
title: Kirk Shooting Suspect Permitted to Wear Plain Clothes in Court

author: Nathan R Dean
description: US-China deals lined up leave some key issues unresolved.
title: Trump's Trip Puts Focus on Asia and Meeting with Xi

author: Maggie Eastland
description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. is teaming up with the US Energy Department to develop a pair of supercomputers at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory that will deploy the company’s artificial intelligence chips to seek breakthroughs in energy and scientific research.
title: AMD’s AI Chips to Power Supercomputers at Energy Department Lab

author: Patricia Garip
description: Venezuela is threatening to revoke energy deals with neighboring Trinidad and Tobago for its support of a US military offensive in the Caribbean, potentially raising the economic cost of the twin-island nation’s alliance with the Trump administration.
title: Venezuela Threatens to End Trinidad Gas Deals Over US Alliance

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Sebastian Boyd
description: President Donald Trump said the US made “a lot of money” by bailing out Argentina.
title: US Turns Small Peso Profit From Big Bet on Argentine Elections

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK’s fiscal watchdog is expected to downgrade its productivity growth forecast by about 0.3 percentage points, amounting to a financial hit to the public finances of more than £20 billion, the Financial Times reported.
title: UK Watchdog to Cut Productivity Forecast by 0.3 Points, FT Reports

author: William Standring
description: The UK’s deputy national security adviser said he was surprised at the collapse of a case against two men accused of spying for China that relied on evidence he was giving on the government’s behalf.
title: UK Security Adviser Says China Spy Case Collapse Surprised Him

author: Laura Davison
description: President Donald Trump has again flirted with extending his stay at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.
title: Can Trump Serve a Third Term as President? What the 22nd Amendment Says

author: William Horobin
description: France’s National Assembly adopted an amendment on Monday that would increase taxes on the country’s largest companies next year, part of the government’s effort to rein in the deficit and find compromises with opposition lawmakers.
title: French Budget Amendment Hikes Corporate Tax in Compromise Bid

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Ivory Coast’s octogenarian leader won a fourth term in elections that excluded his main rivals.
title: Ivory Coast Leader Wins Fourth Term With Main Rivals Sidelined

author: Thomas Seal, Melissa Shin
description: The leader of Ontario declined to apologize for sponsoring an anti-tariff television commercial that US President Donald Trump used as a reason to terminate high-stakes trade talks with Canada.
title: Ontario Premier Says He’s Not Sorry for Ad That Blew Up Trade Talks

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the prospects for Ukraine are improving after President Donald Trump imposed sanctions on Russian oil, a sign Kyiv’s allies are cautiously optimistic that a hardening US stance could damage the Kremlin’s ability to sustain its war.
title: UK’s Starmer Says Ukraine in ‘Better Place’ After Trump Pivot

author: Jorge Valero, William Wilkes
description: The European Union and China will hold talks this week to address trade disputes as Beijing’s restrictions on exports of key minerals and chips risk disrupting Europe’s auto industry.
title: EU and China to Hold Talks to Defuse Trade Spat Over Rare Earths

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: A Catalan separatist political party that props up Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s Spanish government said it will withdraw support for his coalition and move into the opposition, making passage of a 2026 budget highly unlikely.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Loses Catalan Ally in Setback for Budget Talks

author: Veena Ali-Khan, Matthew Miller, Dani Burger
description: Dry-bulk shippers are watching to see when Beijing will resume purchases of US soybeans amid China-US trade talks, said Genco Shipping & Trading Ltd. Chief Executive Officer John C. Wobensmith.
title: Genco CEO Says China Soybean Plans Are Key for Dry-Bulk Trade

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK signed an £8 billion ($10.7 billion) deal to sell 20 Typhoon fighter jets to Turkey, an order which Prime Minister Keir Starmer portrayed as a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin about NATO’s long-term unity.
title: UK Seals £8 Billion Jets Deal With Turkey in NATO Sign to Putin

author: Annie Massa
description: In late October, President Donald Trump pardoned crypto billionaire Changpeng Zhao, one of the industry’s most powerful men, after he mounted a months-long bid for clemency.
title: How Zhao’s Binance Aided Trump Family Crypto Venture Before Pardon

author: Michael O'Boyle, Alex Vasquez
description: The US is extending a deadline to reach a trade deal with Mexico for several weeks, President Claudia Sheinbaum said, in what would be the latest reprieve Donald Trump has granted his southern neighbor.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Says US Extending Trade Deadline for Several Weeks

author: Gregory Korte
description: The US president’s power to pardon is both one of the most absolute and misunderstood provisions of the Constitution. Rooted in the “prerogative of mercy” of English kings dating back to the seventh century, America’s founders wanted a robust pardon power to allow “easy access to exceptions in favor of unfortunate guilt” by the justice system, as Alexander Hamilton wrote.
title: How US Presidents Wield Their Mighty Power to Pardon

author: Manuela Tobias, Patrick Gillespie
description: A resounding win for Javier Milei’s party in midterm elections late Sunday — with a lifeline from the US — gave the libertarian president new momentum for his quest to overhaul Argentina and break the country’s cycle of debt, default and crisis.
title: Milei Wins New Chance, and Tough Challenge, to Remake Argentina

author: Jamie Tarabay, Erik Wasson
description: The head of the country’s largest union of federal workers called for an end to the government shutdown Monday, ramping up pressure on Democrats to end the impasse.
title: Federal Worker Union Calls to End Shutdown, Pressuring Democrats

author: Alicia Diaz
description: President Donald Trump has hit upon an issue that triggered some rare complaints from congressional Republicans: beef.
title: Trump Sparks Rare GOP Pushback With Purchases of Argentine Beef

author: Peter Laca
description: Czech billionaire opposition leader Andrej Babis moved a step closer to returning to power three weeks after his party dominated a general election.
title: Czech Billionaire Moves Closer to Government After Election Win

author: William Horobin
description: France’s Socialist Party will decide by the end of the week whether to topple the government, following votes in parliament on the left’s push to boost taxes on the wealthy.
title: French Government Heads for Existential Showdown Over Wealth Tax

author: Swati Gupta
description: India will extend verification of electoral rolls to more regions, covering over half a billion voters — a move likely to spark opposition protests over alleged attempts to manipulate elections.
title: India Begins Nationwide Voter Roll Check for 500 Million People

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s top presidential candidates treaded gingerly around the hot-button issues of communist affiliation and reproductive rights during a televised debate ahead of next month’s election.
title: Chile Presidential Foes Address Communism, Reproductive Rights

author: Pius Lukong, Yinka Ibukun
description: Cameroonian President Paul Biya was declared the winner of Oct. 12 elections that were marred by the disqualification of his main challenger, and is set to rule the central African nation until the age of 99 if he completes his eighth term.
title: World’s Oldest President Biya Wins Reelection in Cameroon at 92

author: Jing Li
description: A meeting Thursday between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping is set to be one of the key diplomatic events of the year, with the US-China economic relationship at stake following multiple rounds of escalating tensions and temporary truces.
title: Here Are the Key US-China Issues to Watch in Trump-Xi Summit

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania threatened to close its border with Belarus indefinitely in response to smugglers’ balloons repeatedly disrupting the country’s air traffic, as tensions remain high on NATO’s eastern flank.
title: Lithuania Warns Belarus to Stop Balloons Drifting Over Border

author: James Mayger
description: US, China deal offers temporary ceasefire rather than full armistice.
title: Trump and Xi Call a Truce on Trade, for Now

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet North Korea’s top diplomat during her visit to Moscow, Tass reported, as the two countries continue to deepen their military cooperation.
title: Putin to Meet North Korea’s Foreign Minister as Military Ties Deepen

author: Zoltan Simon
description: A senior US diplomat rejected Hungary’s arguments that the country’s landlocked status left it no choice but to rely on Russian oil, as Washington raises pressure on Budapest to find alternative suppliers.
title: US Boosts Pressure on Hungary to Stop Russian Oil Imports

author: Hallie Gu
description: Chinese buyers are holding back on soybean deals as global markets wait for a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping that could revive trade in the crop between the two nations.
title: China Slows Down Soybean Purchases Ahead of Xi-Trump Summit

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s Prime Minister Mark Carney said he plans to meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping later this week when both leaders are at a summit in South Korea.
title: Carney Says He Will Meet With Chinese President Xi in Korea

author: Simon Marks, Mohammed Alamin
description: Fighting engulfed a major city in western Sudan as members of paramilitary unit seized a key army base, the latest twist in a civil war that’s raged for more than 30 months despite repeated international attempts to broker a ceasefire.
title: Sudanese Paramilitary Force Overruns Darfur City as War Rages On

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Akshat Rathi
description: As COP30 nears, the US’s pressure to keep fossil fuels relevant may empower petrostates, potentially giving them more leverage at the UN talks.
title: How Trump Pressures the World Into Burning More Oil and Gas

author: Colum Murphy, Jing Li
description: Chinese and US trade negotiators have lined up an array of diplomatic wins for Donald Trump and Xi Jinping to unveil at a summit this week. Those easy hits are pleasing investors, but leave deeper core conflicts unresolved.
title: Latest US-China Trade Truce Leaves Fundamental Issues Unresolved

author: Frank Jomo
description: Malawi’s president declared a state of disaster following a warning that more than a fifth of the southern African nation’s population face food insecurity.
title: Malawi President Declares State of Disaster As Hunger Spreads

author: Thomas Seal, Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada is consulting on rules for stablecoins and may announce a major update in the federal budget next week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Canada Accelerates Work on Stablecoin Rules as US Speeds Ahead

author: Daniel Flatley, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump hailed Javier Milei after the Argentine president’s political party staged a comeback victory in Sunday’s midterm elections, vindicating the extraordinary financial backing the US arranged for its South American ally.
title: Trump Hails Milei’s Argentina Win, Says US Made ‘Lot of Money’

author: Josh Wingrove, Brian Platt
description: US President Donald Trump said he didn’t anticipate meeting with Canada “for a while” as he continued to stew over a TV advertisement by the province of Ontario that criticized his tariff regime.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Resume Canada Trade Talks ‘For a While’

author: Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump arrived in Japan Monday, telling reporters he was excited for his meeting with new Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and the prospect of completing a joint deal to promote shipbuilding capacity.
title: Trump Lands In Tokyo Promising to Announce ‘Great Friendship’

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove
description: The airstrike launched by Israeli forces in the Gaza Strip on Saturday didn’t violate terms of the US-brokered ceasefire, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Monday.
title: Israeli Strike Didn’t Violate Ceasefire, Rubio Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he got a MRI during his October visit to Walter Reed Medical Center, without sharing more details on what prompted the imaging test.
title: Trump Says He Received ‘Perfect’ MRI During Walter Reed Visit

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump suggested that he may drop an investigation into whether China violated the terms of his first-term trade deal based on his upcoming talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Suggests He May Drop Probe on First-Term China Trade Deal

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump ruled out the idea of running as a vice presidential candidate in the 2028 election, as some of his supporters urge him to find ways to circumvent the Constitution’s prohibition on a president being elected to three terms.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Run for Vice President in 2028 Election

author: Justin Sink
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Monday confirmed the names of five finalists to succeed Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, with the president saying he expected to make his decision by year-end.
title: Bessent Names Fed Chair Finalists Ahead of Year-End Decision

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan, Patrick Van Oosterom
description: When Dutch voters go to the polls this week, the outcome is likely to be a fractured parliament with no party close to a majority. That will mean lengthy coalition haggling, leaving the country stuck with a caretaker government for some time.
title: Nexperia Fallout Adds to Business Angst Ahead of Dutch Election

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Turkish prosecutors brought new “political espionage” charges against Istanbul’s jailed opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu on Sunday, escalating the legal woes of a politician seen as a potential challenger to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: Turkey Charges Jailed Erdogan Rival Imamoglu With Espionage

author: Daniel Carvalho, Augusta Saraiva
description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he had a “surprisingly good” meeting with US President Donald Trump, and predicted a “definitive solution” over bilateral disputes within days.
title: Lula Sees ‘Definitive Solution’ With US Coming Within Days

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: The Chinese Communist Party’s official mouthpiece called on the world’s biggest economies to “jointly safeguard hard-won achievements” from their latest trade talks, ahead of a high-stakes meeting between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.
title: China Asks US to Protect ‘Hard-Won’ Results Before Xi-Trump Meeting

author: Philip Glamann
description: A US helicopter and fighter jet separately crashed in the South China Sea, with the incidents occurring 45 minutes apart and coinciding with a visit by President Donald Trump to Asia.
title: US Navy Helicopter and Fighter Jet in Separate South China Sea Crashes

author: John Liu, Jing Zhao, Yujing Liu
description: China should let investment play a larger role in boosting the economy, a former central bank adviser said, breaking with the views of other prominent analysts by arguing in favor of a big infrastructure construction push.
title: Ex-PBOC Adviser Makes Outlier Call for 2008-Style Mega Stimulus

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan is widely expected to hold interest rates on Thursday at its first meeting since Sanae Takaichi, an advocate of easy monetary policy, became prime minister.
title: BOJ Expected to Hold at First Meeting Since Takaichi Became PM

author: Sakura Murakami, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Support for Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s new government started on a high note according to polls conducted over the weekend, giving her some momentum as she prepares for a visit by US President Donald Trump that could give the new premier another boost.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Support Starts on High Note as Trump Arrives

author: Winnie Hsu, Sangmi Cha
description: The talks between the US and China this weekend were positive as the countries came to terms on a range of contentious points, setting the stage for leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping to finalize a deal this week, according to analysts.
title: US-China Trade Framework a Positive, Await Signoff, Analysts Say

author: Patrick Gillespie, Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei’s party won Argentina’s midterm vote Sunday, a result that will give the libertarian leader a stronger foothold in Congress as he seeks to pass major reforms to boost the nation’s beleaguered economy.
title: Milei’s Party Wins Argentina Midterm Vote in Major Comeback

author: Alastair Gale, Mayumi Negishi
description: Japanese companies have, little by little, been cracking the door open to more defense exports. A new political coalition is now poised to kick it all the way down.
title: Takaichi Moves to Unleash Japan’s Long-Stifled Defense Industry
